g.text: Int. J. Environ. Res. Public Health
Int. J. Environ. Res. Public Health
The previous NDVI time series data (
Distortion of climatic data may occur due to changes in the observation instruments and the
surrounding environment of the observation spots. For data from meteorological stations, it is
necessary to conduct homogeneity test to eliminate the unavailable data; for some missing data of
the meteorological stations, linear regression method is used for interpolation and supplementation
[43]. In the existing studies, Thin Plate Spline and Kriging are commonly used for air temperature
interpolation [44], Kriging and Thin Plate Spline for precipitation interpolation [45], Kriging and
Inverse Distance Weighting (IDW) for relative humidity interpolation [46], and Kriging, Cokriging
and other methods for sunshine duration spatial interpolation [47]. In this paper, as the accuracy of
station interpolation data is verified, we finally decided to select IDW for relative humidity
interpolation, Kriging for precipitation and sunshine duration interpolation. Because air temperature
has a certain altitude sensitivity [48], the spatial interpolation of air temperature is carried out by
using DEM as the covariate with the interpolation method of the partial thin plate smoothing splines
Based on the analysis of the variation trend of NDVI in the growing season in TP during 2001–
2017 with the method of linear regression, the formula is:
represents the NDVI value of the year
inter-annual variation slope of a pixel NDVI; positive value of
indicates that the NDVI shows an
increasing trend, and vice versa. According to the results of the significance test, the trend is divided
Multi-variate statistical analysis often uses correlation analysis and regression analysis. The
multiple regression analysis method requires samples to obey a typical probability distribution,
which has a large amount of calculation and a complicated calculation process. Correlation analysis
method generally requires that each variable meet the joint normal distribution, and in the analysis

meteorological stations, linear regression method is used for interpolation and supplementation [

]. In this paper, as the accuracy of station
interpolation data is veriﬁed, we ﬁnally decided to select IDW for relative humidity interpolation,
Kriging for precipitation and sunshine duration interpolation. Because air temperature has a certain
], the spatial interpolation of air temperature is carried out by using DEMas the
covariate with the interpolation method of the partial thin plate smoothing splines method.
Based on the analysis of the variation trend of NDVI in the growing season in TP during 2001–2017
with the method of linear regression, the formula is:
represents the NDVI value of the year
inter-annual variation slope of a pixel NDVI; positive value of
indicates that the NDVI shows an
increasing trend, and vice versa. According to the results of the signiﬁcance test, the trend is divided
Multi-variate statistical analysis often uses correlation analysis and regression analysis.
The multiple regression analysis method requires samples to obey a typical probability distribution,
which has a large amount of calculation and a complicated calculation process. Correlation analysis
method generally requires that each variable meet the joint normal distribution, and in the analysis
